pageContext.claim: “Your dairy products now and all of the farm products, the ta -- the, the tariffs to Canada. And Mexico, but the tariffs to Canada are now reduced and gotten rid of. Because you were being taken care of, you were being treated horribly, absolutely horribly by Canada.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's claims about future dairy exports to Canada are too optimistic. Before USMCA, the U.S. exported $675 million in dairy products to Canada a year, with some estimates that trade could eventually increase by $300 million. That would be about a 50 percent increase, but a Merrill Lynch research report suggested the gain would only be about $70 million. As for "very quickly," farmers quickly complained Canada was dragging its feet on implementing tariff-rate quotas and so in December, the U.S. Trade Representative announced the very first enforcement action to ensure compliance with the agreement.
